Interface Function<D,R>

Type Parameters:
D - the domain type
R - the range type
All Known Subinterfaces:
ContinuousFunction<D,R>, DifferentiableFunction<D,R>, MultivariateFunction, ParametricCurve, ParametricSurface, ScalarField<V>, ScalarFunction<D>, UnivariateFunction, VectorField<V>, VectorFunction<D,R>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BezierCurve, Circle, Cone, Cylinder, Ellipse, Ellipsoid, Helix, Paraboloid, Sphere, Torus
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface Function<D,R>
Base interface for all mathematical functions.

A function maps elements from a domain D to a range R.

Since:
2.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

    Description

    andThen(Function<? super R, ? extends T> after)
    Composes this function with another function.

    Composes this function with a function before it.
    R
    evaluate(D x)
    Evaluates the function at the given point.

  • Method Details

    • evaluate

      R evaluate(D x)
      Evaluates the function at the given point.
      Parameters:
      x - the input value
      Returns:
      the output value

    • andThen

      default <T> Function<D,T> andThen(Function<? super R, ? extends T> after)
      Composes this function with another function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the new range type
      Parameters:
      after - the function to apply after this one
      Returns:
      the composed function

    • compose

      default <T> Function<T,R> compose(Function<? super T, ? extends D> before)
      Composes this function with a function before it.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the new domain type
      Parameters:
      before - the function to apply before this one
      Returns:
      the composed function
